global_governance.escalation_policy: Failure at any section -> escalate to supervisor

validation_criteria.prerequisite_satisfaction: Each content unit's prerequisites must precede it in sequence

sections.description: Framework defining how to validate prerequisite dependencies and ensure logical content ordering before delivery.

validation_criteria.load_distribution: No cognitive load spikes exceeding learner capacity
validation_criteria.pacing_feasibility: Content pacing matches available time and attention

sections.description: Framework defining how to optimize content sequence for coherence, cognitive load management, and learning flow.

validation_criteria.schema_alignment: Content schema must match platform requirements
validation_criteria.resource_feasibility: Bandwidth and storage must accommodate content

sections.description: Framework defining how to validate technical feasibility of content delivery on target platform.

validation_criteria.device_compatibility: Selected modality works on learner's device

sections.description: Framework defining how to match content modalities to learner needs, preferences, and device capabilities.

validation_criteria.version_consistency: All content units use compatible versions

sections.description: Framework defining how to ensure content quality, consistency, and integrity across the learning sequence.
Framework defining how to enforce external constraints including regulatory, privacy, time, and accessibility requirements.

validation_criteria.completeness: All required fields present in handoff spec
validation_criteria.traceability: All decisions traceable to upstream evidence
validation_criteria.msa_readiness: Spec format matches MSA input requirements

sections.description: Framework defining how to package content sequencing decisions for handoff to Modality Selection Agent (MSA).

validation_criteria.all_specifications_resolved: Every specification has MATCH, UPLOAD, or GENERATE route
validation_criteria.no_orphan_specifications: No specification left without content source

sections.core_principle: Automatically route each specification to the optimal content source: existing catalog, user upload, or AI generation.
sections.description: Framework defining how to acquire actual content to fulfill CSA specifications. Routes to MATCH (existing), UPLOAD (user-provided), or GENERATE (AI-created).

Framework for discovering, evaluating, and segmenting open educational content from external sources (YouTube, OER repositories, MOOCs). Enables AI to find existing content that matches specifications rather than generating new content.

validation_criteria.full_coverage: 100% of scaffold layers have complete content specifications
validation_criteria.specification_completeness: Each specification includes: type, depth, length, difficulty, topic, prerequisites
validation_criteria.pedagogical_alignment: Specifications align with scaffold layer's pedagogical intent
validation_criteria.feasibility_check: Specifications are realistic given time/platform constraints

sections.core_principle: CSA does NOT create the learning path - CogniStruct does. CSA SPECIFIES what content is NEEDED for each scaffold layer. Content may or may not exist yet.
sections.description: Framework defining how to SPECIFY content requirements for each CogniStruct scaffold layer. CSA does NOT assume content exists - it specifies what is NEEDED.
